name: Vinay Ramkrishnan
title: Graduate Student (MSIT-Mobility) - Carnegie Mellon University
summary: I am a MSIT - Mobility, graduate student at Carnegie Mellon University graduating in December 2015. I am actively seeking software development roles. A brief description of my work below: Mobile technology enthusiast, with a extensive experience in android application development for handsets, tablets, Google TV, Google Glass and Android Wearables!. Possess good analytical and development skills, that have helped me tackle challenges during the course of several challenging, popular and highly successful android applications. Have experience of working on android back in the days when Android Donut versions were popular in the market. Have literally seen the platform evolve to what it is today. I also have considerable amount of experience in developing J2ME applications and games, specifically for Nokia Asha Series of phone.

projects.title: QuiltView ++
projects.description: A Real-time Streaming Channel on Google Glass that allows Glass users to start a streaming channel so that other users can watch a live video stream through a web app.

projects.title: Pointshelf
projects.description: App development...design implementation..architecture...basically involved in every possible development phase of this app..

projects.title: Social Media Framework
projects.description:
Social media framework for Android, is an integrated jar/package that can be used by any android mobile application. This jar will integrate features and functionalities of some popular social networking websites like Twitter, Facebook, and MySpace etc which can be used by other android mobile application to provide direct access to users’ accounts on these websites. 
This project was undertaken under the guidance of Xoriant Solutions Pvt Ltd.

projects.title: EDigs Application
projects.description: EcoDigs explores multi-stakeholder interactions around tenant/landlord decision making. Our research looks into at the interactions within and around a crowdsourcing model for collecting lifestyle and cost information that can support the house-hunting process, and if this interaction may be leveraged to improve the safety, efficiency and quality of life choices made by tenants during their house hunt.

projects.title: Cura - Patient Care Health Management System
projects.description:
Developed a health care management system which collects data from various wearables devices and visualize them on a web/mobile based dashboard
- As a part of the Wearables team, built an Android application which runs a data collection service which collects data from wearables devices like Zephyr Bioharness 3, iHealth (BP & SPO2), Withings Pule Oxymeter devices and send it to the database server.
- As a part of Dashboard team, developed a web based dashboard using ionic platform and AngularJS to develop patient management user interfaces and push notifications.

projects.title: Query the Crowd
projects.description:
- Created a crowd sourced twitter bot which takes questions from users on twitter and responds with the most popular answer from the crowd and pprovides a live update of answers on a responsive web page
- Answers obtained by programmatically posting the questions on the crowd sourcing platform, Amazon mechanical Turk
- Technologies used: Node JS, JavaScript, JQuery, Python, Python Shell, Twitter API, D3, Amazon Mechanical Tuks APIs.

projects.title: Discover Transit Android Mobile Application
projects.description:
[1st Place – Convergence Innovation Competition 2012: Societal Impact Category]

Worked as the lead developer on an Android mobile application that enables users to quickly and easily find real-time public transit information nearby. Designed RESTful API to provide real-time bus coordinates and times, and developed native Android application utilizing maps, device location, and an SQLite database.
